The 'illegal drug trade' is a global black market, dedicated to cultivation,
manufacturing, distribution, and sale of drugs, which are subject to drug
prohibition laws. Most jurisdictions prohibit trade, except under license, of
many types of drugs by drug prohibition laws while there is also a trade in
avoiding paying tax on what are legal drugs, such as tobacco.

A UN report said "the global drug trade generated an estimated US$321.6 billion
in 2003." "[http://www.boston.com/news/world/europe/articles/2005/06/30/un_-
report_puts_worlds_illicit_drug_trade_at_estimated_321b/ UN report puts world's
illicit drug trade at estimated USD$321b]". Boston.com. June 30, 2005.
With a world GDP of US$36 trillion in the same year, the illegal drug trade may
be estimated as slightly less than 1% (0.893%) of total global output.
Consumption of illegal drugs is widespread globally.
